article.headline: Portland 70, Portland State 52
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Darren Cooper had 18 points and five assists to lead Portland to a 70-52 victory over Portland State on Wednesday. Cooper was 7-for-8 from the floor, including 4-of-5 from 3-point range, as the Pilots won for the fifth time in their last six meetings with their crosstown rival. Portland (3-5) led the entire way and had its biggest lead at 56-29 midway through the second half. Faced with possibility of suffering its worst loss in series history, Portland State scored 11 straight points to the cut the lead to 16. Cooper stopped the mini-comeback with a 3-pointer and a lay-up, and the Pilots were never threatened. Ryan Sommer had 15 points to lead the Vikings (2-6) and Josh Neeley added 13. Pooh Jeter and Kevin Field scored 14 points apiece for Portland, which shot 54 percent from the field. The Vikings shot less than 40 percent and turned the ball over 22 times. ^

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
